sen.j: 首座（しゅそ）は禅宗の修行僧のリーダーをさす役職名。
sen.e: Syuso is a name of a position of the leader of ascetic monks in Zen sects.
Syuso is a name for the position of the leader of ascetic monks in Zen sects.
Shuso is a name for the position of the leader of ascetic monks in Zen sects.

sen.j: 六頭首（ろくちょうしゅ）の第一位。
sen.e: It is the highest position of the Rokuchoshu (six positions to lead monks).
It is the highest position of the Rokuchoshu (six positions of lead monks).

sen.j: 長老、第一座（だいいちざ）と尊称される。
sen.e: It is worshipfully called as Choro (doyen) or Daiichiza (the first position).

sen.j: 臨済宗では役職名であると同時に僧階の一つでもある。
sen.e: In Rinzai sect, it is a name of an position and also a name of a rank of priest.
In the Rinzai sect, it is the name of a position and also the name of a priestly rank.

sen.j: 禅宗では修行僧は僧堂と呼ばれる修行堂を中心に修行を進める。
sen.e: In the Zen sects, ascetic monks train mainly in training hall called "sodo."
In the Zen sects, ascetic monks train mainly in training halls called "sodo."

sen.j: 制中（せいちゅう）と呼ばれる夏冬の修行期間には外部との連絡を一切絶ち修行に集中する。
sen.e: During the training periods in summer and winter called "seityu", monks concentrate on training cutting off contacts with outside of the temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the training periods in summer and winter called "seityu," monks concentrate on training and therefore cut off contacts with parties outside the temple.
During the training periods in summer and winter called "seichu," monks concentrate on training and therefore cut off contacts with parties outside the temple.

sen.j: 首座はこの期間、修行僧のリーダーを務める者をいう。
sen.e: The leader of the monks during these periods called "syuso."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The leader of the monks during these periods is called "syuso."
The leader of the monks during these periods is called "shuso."

sen.j: 首座は制中に先立って住職から任命され、他の修行僧とは別に一室を与えられて一層の修行精進を求められる。
sen.e: The syuso, who is appointed prior to the seityu from the chief priest, is given a dedicated room separated from other monks and requested to train more severely.
The syuso, who is appointed by the chief priest prior to the seityu, is given a dedicated room separated from other monks and is requested to train more intensively.
The shuso, who is appointed by the chief priest prior to the seichu, is given a dedicated room separated from other monks and is requested to train more intensively.
sen.cmt: shusoに訂正しました。seichuに訂正しました。

sen.j: 特に曹洞宗では首座には制中期間内に取り組むべき公案が与えられる。
sen.e: Especially in Soto sect, syuso is given a koan (question) on which the syuso must focus during the period of seityu.
Particularly in the Soto sect, the syuso is given a koan (question) on which the syuso must focus during the period of seityu.
Particularly in the Soto sect, the shuso is given a koan (question) on which the shuso must focus during the period of seichu.
sen.cmt: shusoに訂正しました。seichuに訂正しました。

sen.j: 解制（制中期間の終了）後、首座は住職の代理として他の修行僧達を相手に法問答を行い自らの境地を示さなければならない。
sen.e: After the kaisei (end of a seityu period), the syuso, as a representative of the chief priest, must express own spiritual state by answering the question related with Dharma from the other ascetic monks.

sen.j: この儀式を法戦式という。
sen.e: This ceremony is called "Hossen shiki" (literally, Dharma combat).

sen.e: In every Zen sects, executing the duty of syuso is one of the conditions to get qualification for being the chief priest.

sen.e: In every Zen sect, executing the duty of syuso is one of the conditions under which to obtain qualification for being the chief priest.

sen.j: 現在では実際の修行とは別に形式的に首座任命、法戦式を行う場合も多い。
sen.e: At present, appointment to the syuso and the Hossen shiki are often performed for form's sake separately with the actual trainings.

sen.j: 首座は原則として一制中に一人であるが、江戸時代以前には規模の大きい僧堂では前堂首座（ぜんどうしゅそ）と後堂首座（ごどうしゅそ）の二人制を取る場合もあった。
sen.e: Generally, one syuso is appointed during one seityu, but until the Edo period, some of large priest halls had two syusos, which are zendo syuso and godo syuso.
Generally, one syuso is appointed during one seityu, but until the Edo period some of large priest halls had two syusos, which were the zendo syuso and godo syuso.
Generally, one shuso is appointed during one seichu, but until the Edo period some of large priest halls had two shusos, which were the zendo shuso and godo shuso.
